TestDescription.name: WordPress plugin WPtouch insecure nonce generation
TestDescription.Description: Marc-Alexandre Montpas reported a security issue in the popular WordPress plugin WPtouch that could potentially allow a user with no administrative privileges, who was logged in (like a subscriber or an author), to upload PHP files to the target server.
TestDescription.Impact: This vulnerability can only be triggered if your website allows guest users to register. An attacker could potentially take over your website by uploading a backdoor.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Upgrade to the latest version of WPtouch (this problem was fixed in version 3.4.3).

Reference.database: Disclosure: Insecure Nonce Generation in WPtouch
